column4: Anyone else see the partimage package in their package manager?
For 10.04, that is...
only partimage-doc according to apt-cache
That can't be right...
partimage is supposedly in the universe repo for 10.04.
xbonesx is having the same problem: only partimage-doc
updating... let's see
I had him refresh his packages too.
did tey change the package name
Nope. It's called: partimage
that's all im getting too... so...
64-bit?
yes
That might be why...
I only see an i386 package.
perhaps there's a .deb out there somewhere or a ppa ?
Hm, not sure. It's a popular program though.
apparently it has issues with 64 bit http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=191205
i mean couldn't you use another tool for now like clonezilla or something
I recommended Clonezilla, since it's a LiveCD.
i use it all the time it's wonderful
